alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Greene; Eastern Rensselaer; Eastern Schenectady; Montgomery; Northern Saratoga; Northern Washington; Schoharie; Southeast Warren; Southern Fulton; Southern Saratoga; Southern Washington; Western Albany; Western Columbia; Western Greene; Western Rensselaer; Western Schenectady; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 10:18AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of moderate to heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile, were impacting the region. These bands of moderate to locally heavy snow are producing snowfall rates of up to one inch per hour. Up to two inches of new snowfall is possible by Noon. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1015 AM EST, bands of moderate to heavy snow was across the Capital Region, the Sacandaga Area, the Lake George Saratoga Region into southern Vermont and the Berkshires. These bands are slowly shifting eastward. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Albany, Schenectady, Troy, Pittsfield, Bennington, Clifton Park, Rotterdam, Saratoga Springs, Kingston, Amsterdam, East Greenbush, Cohoes, Glens Falls, North Adams, Brattleboro, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Colonie, Scotia and Hudson Falls. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 27. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 7, and between exits 8A and 18. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
